comment.name: Scott
comment.comment:
Hello,
Chris - I had written you about this laptop. Just got mine. Hit 7056 on 3DMark2001SE compared to around 5000 with my Inspiron 8200 2 GHz-M with a GeForce4 440 card. Happy with the purchase. The *only* thing is the viewing angle. The enhanced UXGA on the Dell is much wider, so if you're doing Photoshop work full-screen images look more evenly lit on the Dell. *But* the Sager stays bright when you use battery power vs. AC. The Dell tones down the screen on battery power to save juice.
I've just installed all the software...time to play... :)
PS - For anyone thinking of getting a larger hard drive: the Sager uses a 9.5mm 40GB Toshiba drive. IBM's 5400RPM 60GB drive is 12.5mm, so it won't fit the Sager's 9.5mm hard drive chassis. I believe you can get a Toshiba 60GB that will fit, but it will run at the slower 4200rpm. In other words, if you want 5400rpm, the largest drive you can get for the Sager at the moment is 40GB.
Just a bit of trivia for those wanting more space....

comment.name: maenorth

-- mae

comment.name: Scott
comment.comment:
The keyboard is nice; similar to the Dell in feel, but not laid out exactly the same. It's very springy. The only thing I [personally] don't like about it is that the CTRL key is smaller than what you would find on the Dell. The Sager has a Fn (Function key) in addition to the CTRL key, whereas the Dell has one wide CTRL key in the same amount of space.
So...if you're working in Photoshop, for example, or doing much copying-and-pasting, you have to be more precise on the Sager with your typing (or pinky) when using CTRL-V or CTRL-C. I sometimes find myself hitting the "Fn" key when I want to be hitting the CTRL key.
Pretty minor, but I thought I'd note it.
Otherwise, a very nice keyboard.

comment.name: Scott
comment.comment: Hello, I don't know how much Chris checks in here, so I'll give an answer. The laptop comes with a standard AC adapter that can be plugged into a wall. PowerNotebooks.com sells an auto inverter, but I'm going to guess it's the same as what you can get at Radio Shack. The only issue I've had with auto inverters is that I once had one that caused noise/feedback when I used it with my Dell laptop, but I don't know if this happens with other models. I have never timed it, but it usually takes a few hours to charge two onboard batteries from 50% (which is how much I normally use). Using the 2nd modular bay for a spare battery should give you around 3 hours or so of use. In my personal experience, trying to charge the battery while using the laptop will result in longer charge times. For example: I use the laptop for about an hour each morning on battery, then I plug it in when I get to work. It takes most of the workday to bring two batteries back from 50% to 100% if the laptop is on and being used, but less time if the laptop is off. SCREEN: This is truly personal preference. I don't like anything less than UXGA...although SXGA+ is decent. The problem with UXGA is that font size is reduced, but the positive tradeoff is that you have a sharper screen. To deal with the decrease of the font size with the resolution increase, you can set your preferences in Windows and Explorer for larger fonts/larger icons. You can also get a program called LiquidView from Portrait Displays which helps you quickly adjust your settings: http://us.portrait.com/products/lv.htm You should also activate Cleartype: http://www.microsoft.com/typography/cleartype/default.htm After doing those things, most text/resolution issues should be resolved. Many application menus will still be small, but I [personally] have gotten used to it as a necessary evil to have the sharp screen. It's an ongoing conflict: higher resolution -> smaller type -> pixels less visible lower resolution -> bigger type -> pixels more visible. I would strongly recommend previewing laptops at a local electronics store and comparing different native screen resolutions (XGA vs. SXGA vs. UXGA).

comment.name: Christopher H. Laco
comment.comment:
To bo honest, I have no idea. Neither the supplied USB2 drivers on the CD-ROM that came with the lappy nor the ones downloaded from the Sager site would install...they would just sit there in the background after being double clicked.
What I ended up doing was expanding the xp*.cab file in the USB2 directory, and choosing Update Drivers within the decive manager for the VIA USBController.
The other part of my problem appreared to be the drivers that came with the USB/Firewire enclosure itself. Eventually I ended up deinstalling all USB stuffs under device manager, uninstalling the USB enclosure driver from Add/Remove programs, and letting XP refind everything. After that, everything was happy again.
I love technology. I never had any problems with USB mice or USB memory card readers. It was probably a driver vs. mass storage device drver issues.

Is it the same situation on the Sager/Alienware 54m? or is the chip soldered right onto the main board? comment.name: Scott
comment.comment:
You haven't gotten an answer and probably won't get an answer.
First, Sager, Alienware and Dell all have the official line that video cards are not upgradeable. A Dell technician *might* tell you that you can upgrade the video card yourself, but in doing so, you violate your warranty. The only place I've found that even carries the video cards by themselves is on eBay, and my last attempt to purchase one fell-through after a month of the seller having $250 of my money. It isossible you could get one from a technician though...when I tried to get one directly from Dell, I spent 7 hours on the phone.
Since opening up most laptop cases violates the warranty and there are few online technical guides for doing so, very few people will be willing to do it to answer your question. Sorry! I've spent a lot of time looking for the same answer.

comment.name: MikeN
comment.comment:
Hi Chris, very nice review! I'd like to make a few comments and ask a couple of questions.. I bought a Sager 5620 back in October, just before they released the 5660. It was a P4 2.0 with the UXGA screen and the Radeon Mobility 7500 chipset. The performance was blazing fast, I played Jedi Outcast, Return to Castle Wolfenstein, Madden 2003, and several other 3D intensive games at full frame rate without missing a beat, it would be perfect for a LAN party. It also ran Photoshop and 3DS Max perfectly. But, I was unhappy with the screen quality and I ended up returning it. The problem was that there were little 'waves' going horizontilly across the bottom of the screen. If you were looking at it straight on with a solid color screen (like a blank Notepad screen opened to fullscreen) it looked like it got darker and lighter across the bottom of the screen. If you looked a little from the side you could clearly see that the screen was waving in and out a little across the bottom. Sager sent me a replacement laptop and it had the exact same problem. Their tech support looked at some others on the line and determined that its a normal trait of those screens. Have you noticed anything like that on your 5660? The other thing I didn't like was that it doesn't have a serial port and I still have a couple of serial devices that I wanted to use with it.
Incidentally, I had purchased mine from discountlaptops.com with a cashier's check and they were great, even when I requested a refund (which I promptly received). I would encourage anyone thinking about buying a Sager to take a look at them and talk to Matt there, you'll save quite a bit of money compared to the other Sager dealers. Mine did not have the Sager sticker/logo on it either.
I've held off in purchasing another laptop since I returned the 5620, and now of course the Sager's have the ATI Radeon Mobility 9000 chipset and USB 2.0. Mmmmm. I'm considering getting an 8886, I'd like the larger screen and the numeric keypad, plus it has a serial port and 2 pc card slots, and even though it doesn't have dual battery capability it has a larger battery and when Laptop Magazine reviewed it it lasted about 2 1/2+ hours, which is not bad for a laptop that size. Someone else commented that they have never seen reviews for Sager laptops in any magazines.. there have been several reveiws for various models in Laptop Magazine, including the 8886 and the 5620 (I dont think I've seen one for the 5660 yet). Both of them got excellent reviews, the only drawback with both of them being size and weight. I am disappointed that cnet.com and zdnet.com haven't reveiwed any of the new Sagers, there's a couple of very old reviews on them, but those sites are 100% ad driven, and there's a ton of Dell, Toshiba, Compaq, HP, etc ads everywhere. I'll bet when you see a Sager ad on cnet.com you'll see reviews of the 5660 and the 8886. Keep your eye out for reviews of Alienware or Prostar laptops too, they're the same as Sagers. All of those companies buy the laptops from a company called Clevo (www.clevo.com.tw) and put their names on it, and in Alienware's case paint it a funky color and put a 5400 rpm hard drive in it. That explains why some people get their laptop with a company's logo on it and some dont.
Sorry for rambling on.. if you've read this far can you (or anyone else with any model Sager laptop) let me know if you've experienced the same issues with the screen that I described? I may take a shot with the 8886, maybe my 5620 was part of a bad batch of screens, or maybe it only effects the 15" UXGA screens.
MikeN

comment.name: quiet1key
comment.comment: Regarding USB ports: To my knowledge, there are no reported hardware flaws in the USB ports installed on these systems; the problem is getting WinXP to recognize them as 2.0 ports instead of 1.1. The USB 2.0 drivers supplied by the manufacturers for the 5600Ds series of notebooks produced by Clevo Taiwan (also sold under the names Sager NP56xx, ProStar 5654/5600D, Alienware Area-51m in the U.S.) will not install correctly under WinXP. The reason is that the latest installer engine (v2.40) that comes with the driver bundle is buggy and, in my experience, will actually cease operation after unpacking the InstallShield data. I've seen only two working solutions for this up to now; one being what Chris had described earlier on: unpacking the XP drivers from the CAB archive and installing them manually. The second way is to find the driver bundle that comes with the previous version of the installer (v2.24 - see URL http://www2.driverguide.com/cgi/download.cgi?uploads14/23187/VIA_USB2_Driver Package_V224.zip). The versions of the actual drivers in this bundle are not different than the newest one, only the installer is different so you'll still be getting the latest drivers. Worked just fine for my ProStar5654...

comment.name: razzy
comment.comment:
Ok, I just found this site by mistake trying to find some information about Linux on NP5600 series...I hope this might help somebody.
I bought my laptop from Mtech 2 years ago. I did some research before that and I reached the conclusion that Mtech, Prostar and Sager sell the same model, just the price is different. Before this one I had a Sager 3380 (if I remember well) which I know for sure that still works... and it was bought from Powernotebooks, many thanks to Donald!
Back to NP5600, it'a P4 2G, originally with 256 DDR, 20Gb, DVD, Floppy, 1400x1050 TFT.
I have to mention that the notebook came from Prostar, confirming my thoughts about the manufacturers. I was pleased in the beginning, because the NP feels pretty sturdy. My happiness went away after about one month when I noticed some kind of flickering in the screen. I called Mtech customer service, and they told me to call Prostar, since they service both Prostar and Mtech.
After talking to somebody from Prostar, I decided to wait a little more to see what was happening. I watched the screen for almost a year and what bothered me the most was that sometimes when I was focused on something on the screen I could notice the flickering. It didn't happen all the time, just occasionally, and it was worse when I was moving the screen back and forth, but again, not all the time!
As a computer technician I know that these kind of problems drive crazy everybody in the service!
In the meantime the latch broke, so I decided that it was time to call Prostar and send it there for repair. Another "little" thing was a label on the LCD, in the lower left corner, which was coming out more and more...
I have to mention that Prostar has a 72 hours repair policy. Well, on the website!
After the notebook got there I called Prostar again and talked to somebody, explaining him in detail what happens, when and what to look for. The guy seemed nice and we agreed to talk in 1-2 days.
I called again in about 2 days and he told me that they couldn't notice anything wrong (that't how it always happens!) with the screen and that they need more time to figure out the problem. He also mentioned that they fixed the broken latch and removed the label from the screen.
What could I say? "Ok, take your time and fix it!"
But here the nightmare starts. I call again in a few days, and talk to the same guy, and he starts asking me questions about what kind of flickering ,when, like he didn't understand what I told him probably three times before! The story is just halfway, and now it's very late, so I will continue tomorrow.

comment.name: razzy
comment.comment:
This is the second part of the article that I posted last night.
I forgot to write that before I sent the computer to Prostar I had upgraded the harddrive to a bigger one. It might not seem a big deal, but actually it was a reason for the flickering in their oppinion! First they didn't want to take a look on the laptop, then finally they decided to do it, warning me that "next time" I should have the original configuration.
Anyway, after another week, I found out that they upgraded the Bios to the latest version and apparently somebody noticed a problem which they say it was corrected by reinstalling the video driver. I tried again to tell the guy that the movement of the screen back and forth makes it worse, and I suggested that somebody might losen the hinges a little, as they can put some stress on the screen. He said: "No, they can't be losen, that's how it comes from the factory. If you want put some WD40 on them!" Great answer, isn't it? I payed $1800 to put WD40 on it!
After 1 month I finally got the laptop back. It stayed in the service 3 weeks! It worked fine for a week and after that it started doing exactly the same. Even worse, I noticed that the LCD cover was broken in the lower left corner and the screen was moving inside. Besides, they forgot to put the screw that holds the harddrive in place!
I called them again, and after about 30 min I found out that the warranty expired and they cannot do anything. Although I had extended warranty, it is not covered by Prostar, but by Philips-Magnavox. They mailed me the harddrive screw though.
I was so furious after the conversation, that I open the laptop completely, till the last screw. I didn't care about voiding the warranty, anyway it didn't really exist! And I opened even the hinges, which were rusty inside (how they got rusty, who knows!?). I cleaned them and put some grease on to prevent them from further rusting.
The plastic frame around the screen was broken in the lower left corner, and also the cover had a little metal washer that went out from the plastic enclosure, and that's why the screw didn't hold in that corner. So, after checking the prices ($35 only for the frame), I decided to fix it myself. I put some strong Epoxy and after 24 hours I removed the extra with a Dremel tool.
Since then, no broken corner, no flickering (maybe just once in a while, after the computer comes on from standby, which is normal).
Conclusion: I still like this laptop, because it's very powerful. The harddrive and DVD are Toshiba. It's all in one (floppy, hard, CD), not like Dell either with floppy or CD. The screen is Hitachi, I checked it. So, even though it's not brand name, the components are good quality. I can't say the same about the case, which is not even close to Toshiba or Dell. I opened hundreds of Toshiba and Dell, and I can clearly see the diference in quality...But, if you need a low(er) cost, powerful laptop, I think it's a good choice. Remember to treat it gently. If you need an extra memory, call Apacer directly, they will be more than happy to sell you a 512 Mb for about 100-110, not 160-180 at Prostar. If something else breaks. you don't have too many options: either service (which hopefully will be a better experience), or if it's out of warranty, just to buy the spare part (from Prostar or whoever sells it, because it's proprietary) and to ask somebody to change it. BTW, I have to knock in a wood, it still runs Ok, and it went through hard work: video encodings, 3D design, never let me down.
I hope this will help somebody. Thanks for reading!

comment.name: Michael
comment.comment:
Well if you like Bruce's singing talents you might want to check for one of his solo albums, too. During the time after he left the band (returned to Maiden officially in spring 1999) he worked on some pretty impressive "thunderous" metal albums. Go catch "Accident of Birth" and "The chemical wedding". I think even "Accident in Brazil" [live performance] might be worth a look.
Regarding Maiden's latest works, Bruce has not been in the band only for the albums "The X Factor" and "Virtual XI". Actually Bruce was not in the Band for only three studio albums: the 2 mentioned plus the debut "Iron Maiden" which featured Paul Di'Anno as lead vocals. The other two featured a guy called Blaze Bailey as vocals. Although X-Factor has some tracks influenced/written by Bruce, the band has in my opinion never reached its full potential and that "Iron Maiden touch" with Blaze. That might be the reason why he quit in end of 1998 and Bruce returned....
Would be glad to hear if you like the "solos" .
Yours,
Michael

comment.comment:
I have a similar problem, ended up with a netfinity 5600 and a EXP15 enclosure, also 10 SCSI drives in the enclosure but only 2 in the internal drivebays. Now of cause I want to mirror the internal drives and do RAID 5 on the drives in the enclosure...
I chase a ISO boot image at ibm.com for a week(wtf mate!) and finally boot it of and I am presented with some Linux/X-Free based intefrace and two disks from the enclosure are missing, instead the disks from the internal bay show up... what is that about?
This is kryptonite, so I pull the plugg on the internal drive bay from the ServeRAID PCI card and plugg it in to the on-board scsi controller, now the enclosure reports to contain the drives that are actually there, but I cant see the internal drives, fair enough, there must be some other wigglet for configuring the on-board card BUT WHAT THE IS IT? is it a menu during POST or is it an application that you have to run from Ms Windows?
If anyone knows anything that could help me out, please, or the poor netfinity will have to defy gravity, if but for a short while (4th floor into passengerseat of project managers car)

comment.name: Bill Yates
comment.comment: Years ago, I too purchased an HP N series laptop back when they cost an arm and a leg but declined the extended warranty because I had always been taught that it was a rip-off, just additional income for the retailer, plus I had heard horror stories about repair at Best Buy. Well after about two years of hard travelling and a couple of drops, the unit wouldn't recharge the battery. So, I immeediately sent the unit to HP by FedEx. They arranged pickup and returned the unit with a new mobo and a new top which wasn't even an issue, but it had a small crack in it from one of the drops, in 3 DAYS for $289. The laptop is now 7-8 years old and still plugging away , albeit in a reduced role. Would I do it the same way again? Damn right! The Best Buy repair folks will never get their hands on my stuff.

comment.name: annoyed
comment.comment: I purchased a Sony Vaio at best buy March 2002, I brought the Box in to best buy cause it wouldn't even boot up and if it did it would only stay on for 10-15 mins before locking up. Wannabe comp geek behind the desk ask me if I performed a system restore, another freak told me it was probably over heating and the next overly happy cat told me it was the memory. Feeling just great about the encounter I figured three heads are better than one right. Wrong! They call me a week later and tell me they couldn't find anything wrong with it and to come pick it up. I head down there and I ask them to boot it prior to me carting it back home. So he attempts to and gets the black hole. Great thanks for wasting my time right. Well they tell me to come back in another week so they head tech can work on it. (head tech) hmmmmmm... After 2 weeks of no call and no nothing, I decided to swing on by. Guy tells me they can't boot it, and it locks up in bios. DUH! isn't that what I brought it to you for, to fix it, not tell me what I told you when I brought the F'er in 3 weeks prior. So the guy tells me they are sending it to sony and it should take about 2 weeks and hes shipping it off to them that day. I go on vacation for 3 weeks come back home no calls from best buy. So I head on in to best by again, and the guy tells me that sony just recieved the box the day prior. So where did it sit for almost 3 weeks??? in a laundry basket under the best buy counter? Another week goes by no update from best by, phone there is always busy, so I head in again to see whats up. Guy tells me sony is ordering parts, I ask him what parts, he tells me he does not know... Well alrighty then.... 2 more weeks go buy and still no word, I head in to best buy again, and stand in the cattle line... The asswipe tells me the comp has been back for a few days. I asked him why no one called he said they did. I can't help but refrain myself from jumping over the counter and choking the SOB to death. Yet I smile and ask what sony did? they replaced the motherboard and the processor he explains in a high pitched overly happy voice. It was like fingers on a chalk board.... Basically a new box but why so damn long? Now that I have it home I have discovered that the A drive does not work at all. I wonder how long that will take to replace that at best buy...

comment.name: Hot in So Cal
comment.comment:
Glad I'm not alone. I too grabbed an HP laptop from Best Bye on special. Shortly after HP warranty expires unit won't power up. No biggy, I have the BB exended warranty which, as I was told by billy blue shirt "covers everything". The local store service guy also assured me work was covered. Also asked if they could fix anything else for me free, remember "everything" is covered. Off it goes to Chino (Pomona?) service ctr for repair. 4ish weeks later with no call backs I finally find the # for Service ctr and corner a tech who tells me nothing is covered due to 'incidental damage' Incidental who? I ask. Right there in the no-existent waranty explanation brochure I recieved. Brochure who? I ask. Sorry, entire warranty is void. No help from the other cutomer freindly mgrs at the service ctr. They can however repair the non-warranty power cord/pin problem for a mere $1200! I tell them to put it and themselves in a box and ship it back to my local BB outpost. After no call back I vist local store to pick up unit and local geek tells me he can't understand, but the service ctr is GOD! And please $28.00 in shipping charges. I expressed my opinion in loud terms (no intercom necessary) and manny the mgr graciously agreed to waive the fees. Sent 2 e-mails to BB but heard nothing. Haven't been back since.
BTW: many HP's do solder the power pin directly to the mother board. Also the cord attaches directly adjacent to the heat vent. No wonder it fails in hot So Cal! 2 fixes; HP does direct: 3 major repairs about 2 weeks TAT for around $269. Easier - HP port replicator powers the unit apart from the power pin - $39 on line.

comment.name: Anonymous Coward
comment.comment: HAH, I was searching thru some stuff on Google.com and I found this article. I had the same problem, but I manually installed the updates. Actually it was Windows2000 SP3. Only server for 50-60 users (file, print, Exchange, apps, etc...). I worked around 30 hours straight. Went to work at 9am, server went down at 9pm, and wasnt fully recovered till 2:30p the next day. I recovered thru ' the recovery console, but I also had to do a recovery install. During the recovery install 'beautiful' Windows Setup decide to do something wacky and just sit there after it decided what it was going to install (components section of install). Ended up calling MS Tech Support. When I asked him what was happening in the install he said he didn't know how Windows Setup worked. HAH. His solution: 'Reinstall'. THAT IS WHAT I JUST DID. Ok, I am just rambling now, but I think you understand. Oh, and Exchange had a whole different set of problems. I would use Linux if it wasnt for Exchange Craptastic Server.

comment.name: former employee of bby
comment.comment:
D00d, I sent my laptop to bby for repair because it would lock up and not boot about 98% of the time. I tried to fix the problem for the longest time because(being a former in store service tech, later mobile audio tech) i knew it would take FOREVER to get it back and threaten national security if bby got their hands on MY LAPTOP!!! So after months of no progress, and more and more problems like pretty yellow lines across the LCD, i decided to forfeit and i walked into the mercy of the mighty tech bench at the local best buy with a white flag held high. After saying Hi to all the people I USED TO WORK WITH there I asked them if they had my laptop, welllll finally they did after a month, but thats expected return time. So it was nice to know that my PSP paid for a new LCD, a new hard drive, and anew DVD/CD burner. There it paid for itself right away, and i did NOT have to go through the manufacturer which whould have taken god knows how long. But the bad news was, the latch that holds the laptop closed was broken when they replaced the screen.. =( whatever, didnt really care, and they added another sicker to my collection, but to my expectations THEY LOST MY #$%^#@^% POWER SUPPLY AND THE RESTORE CDS!!! OH GOD!!!, but i didnt really care for the restore CDs in the first place, but i would have thought they would have least used them to insall the operating system back on the laptop before they sent it too me in the even that they had to replace the hard drive, which had LINIX!!! on it... so instead of replacing the hard drive and running the restore CDs, they put DOS on there... oh yeah and it still doesnt power on, i have to put it on its side to start it, and if you bump it... it locks up. I would say its just karma because i was a service tech, but.. its not, because its not theyre fault at the store, they just record the information that you give them, and send it to the service center, the service center gets hundred of orders in every day. Some where between them "fixing" each and every order and them shipping stuff back to the RIGHT store... something paranormal seems to be occuring because from my experience from working there, this was exactly the experience that i was expecting, which cant be what bby wants. Because they WANT you to have a good experience with them so you will come back to spend more money and put circuit city out of business, its called their loyalty one scores. So each store tries to do thier best BUT something somewhere is sabbatoging thier system!! ITS A SHADOW BBY GOVT OR SOMETHING!! THEY PULL OVER THE TRUCKS AND RELEASE SWARMS OF NANO MACHINES TO SCREW YOUR STUFF UP!!! .... nooo wait a min.. that cant be true, maybe its the girl scouts..... ... . .. nope gotta be from bad order of operations... thats it, somewhere in there the guy who checks in the order and the guy who repairs it and send it back to the guy who ships it, they lose you things. (to ebay?) lol wellll im off topic.
ANYWAY one last point, is that all the while your stuff is getting fixed for free (under PSP) and your getting beter turn around time than the manufacturer, you are scoring big time everytime your stuff has to go off for repair.. its called the NO LEMON POLICY!!! Now in my case i am going to have to send my laptop in again to fix this weird on its side starting behavior. THIS will count for a second time that my laptop was SENT to the service center and had parts REPLACED OR REPAIRED, after its sent in to have parts REPLACED OR REPAIED THREE TIMES, and it is sent in a fourth time and it is confirmed that it needs to have parts REPLACED OR REPAIRED, then they call the regional district supervisor surgon generals secretary to get the number to the Seasonal Part Time Corporate No Lemon Authorization Specialist to get go codes and the activation keys for the NO LEMON POLICY, then they mail one key to your store and they turn them at the same time in thier inventory liquidation management software key interface in order to make you order go INSTANTLY from the service center to your store without any extra units floating around, and then there the store has succesfully been authorized and bleesed to give you a NEW COMPARABLE UNIT. Which in the event you have a computer..... your going to get something far better than you had because they dont keep OLD computers in stock. oh yeah, GIG `EM SOONERS err BEARS!!

It sux that this has happent to u and apparently others grrrrrrrrr. And "former employee of bby", I got a kick of out your comments ROFLOL. I've purchased a few things from my local best buy and fortunately have not yet had any problems, phew.

I really think that better organization, knowledgeable ppl and better working environments would help cut down on the amount of time it takes to get things done and done right.
I mean, if u have an 18 wheeler backing up to the door w\ things that need servicing and thats jus stuff that came in to the store Saturday and Sunday, and u have hm, maybe 5 ppl at the service center to work, one proly a manager, 2 r the receiver and shipper, that leaves u one qualified servicer and one trainee, hmm...not quite the ideal situation.
Furthermore, if the things that we buy or that r used (including replacement parts) werent such CRAP (that to your NAFTA CAFTA and beyond) then we wouldnt have to have month to year+ long headaches.
IN my opinion, its not just the fault of one business, one person or a handful, its a collective effort of greedy, moneygrubbing, lazy, dishonest, theiving scumbags driven by their selfish desires, rather than higher standards of quality and care for the whole.

comment.name: infuriated
comment.comment: Gosh...my husband and I are sooo furious right now. We bought a plasma t.v. from best buy just 6 months ago. About a month ago, the controls started acting abnormal. The the control pop up menus would not come on the screen, (like the volume bar that goes up and down, the menu screen that controls color, contrast, etc., and input menu, like antenna, video 1, 2, etc..) So we put in a service request, since we got sucked into purchasing their service plan, which from past experience SUCKS!!! (From our computer not getting repaired/switched out, a vcr which never functioned properly and never got fixed til it finally died, etc...) Sure enough, best buy's incompetence strikes once again....this service technician who supposedly is "manufacturer trained" off the bat asks me for the Toshiba manual...what the hell!! So I asked him, aren't you familiar w/ the t.v.? He says, "no". Man, were we at his mercy from that time on....what am I to do... So he checks it out, and he can't even find the damned serial number...and asked me to help him find it... So he leaves from this first appt. and says he'll be back w/ the part which he will be ordering. He is to ask his supervisor what part he will be needing to repair the t.v. So he returns today, and to make a long story short, our plasma t.v. is now DEAD! He obsiously DID NOT know what he was doing, cuz he kept communicating through walkie talkie to someone who seemed to be walking him through the repair. An hour later, there was black screen and the plasma would not power up anymore. Infuriated, I called the 888bestbuy number, and they had this "I don't care" attitude, and that we are supposed to let him come back with a whole mother board to repair what he has damaged! What is up with that!!! He damaged it, it's only right that they replace it with a new one!! How do I know how much damage he did to the back, and who in their right mind would let him touch their t.v. again!!!! Any suggestions...we are soooo exhausted in fury at this point....we now are in worst shape than before the tech arrived. We have nooo t.v., just a black screen. He sealed up the t.v. and was sooo quick to get out of my house, and did not even leave me any paper work or proof he was here!!!

comment.comment: I've had the same power plug problem recently; I own a ProStar 5654 (basically the same notebook), and as much as i like it there is one fundamental flaw in the case design: the heat vents. instead of scattering multiple exhausts around the case, they've placed one huge vent on the left side toward the back, right next to the power supply jack. if you tend to run graphic-intensive applications or games, the graphics card (sits right below the WASD keys) tends to heat up (hence the need for a huge exhaust right next to it) and the hot air is pushed out with the help of two powerful intake fans positioned underneath the case. of course, everything that is close to the vent will heat up also (the power plug, in this case). I think this is what caused the casing to come loose in the first place...

blogpost.title: VS.NET: How To Lose A Potential Customer

comment.name: Anonymous Coward
comment.comment:
While MS bashing is good fun, think about your complaints:
1) DVD. Nearly everyone has a DVD-ROM. Aside from that, the reason that they put it on a DVD ROM was so that they could ship 1 disc, not 5. If they sent you 5 CD ROMs people would be bitching that they had to switch the CD 4 times, and saying stuff like "Bill you idiot, ever heard of a DVD??".
2) 1.5 GB. Yea, it is too big, but a lot of what you are installing is the documentation, and extra tools. You didn't HAVE to install this stuff, so how can you complain? If you wanted 500 MB of documentation, you can't complain about having to wait while it installs that 500 MB right?
3) Their "trial" is probably different than what we think of as being a "trial". If you wanted to save on buying VS.NET, you could just keep reinstalling the IDE every 50 days. Maybe this argument is weak, I would have been pissed as hell too, just playing devils advocate.
Are there any other good IDEs for developing in .NET? (WebMatrix kinda sucks in comparsion).

comment.name: Anonymous Coward
comment.comment:
We were running into the infamous "timeout on buffer latch type 3" error and was caused by the autogrow in tempdb. Apparently when SQL Server is getting hit pretty hard and tempdb is taking a timeout to auto-grow, SQL server shits its pants and times-out. This combined with the fact that tempdb shrinks down to its last set size after a restart, you'll hit this error pretty regularly after a SQL Server bounce. (If tempdb auto-grow from a set 1GB to 10GB, after the restart tempdb will be 1GB again. - Just how gay is that?)
Anyway, we just manually set tempdb to a respectable level to resolve the problem.

comment.name: J$
comment.comment:
When I started blogging, I went with an extra layer of categorization via two different blogs -- Left Half and Right Half. Now, though, I regret it because a lot of times, an entry "belongs" on both resulting in me having to double post (redundancy == bad). I wish I would have done one "true" blog, and then added some magic URL parsing so that if you went to "/left" you only received technically-oriented entries; similarly, if one went to "/right" they would get the others.
One of these days, I am going to actually get around to consolidating the blogs...
Both ways work -- two blogs versus one blog with heavy usage of multiple categories for each entry + URL-fu. I guess is just depends on the end result. TMTOWTDI.

Hi, i'am a .Net web developer with a MCAD certification.
First at all, the big difrences between IE and other browsers is that it supports every protocoll witch is available for javascript, vbscripts, old style codes, the new style codes(W3C), webforms, objects, applets and DOM refrences. The rest like ASP.NET/PHP and such kinda modules are part of the webserver. Plus microsoft also thinks about the people who don't understand all of this realy good and gives some reactions on code so that the programmer don't have to think verry difficult. Like when you give a window.location a parameter the site will directly refresh. This wasn't the real purpose because you need to give a location en write after that window.replace('url') and not reload because than your cache will not be read but refilled. It's a litle example on how microsoft wan;t to support everything so that you have a standard or you can call it a big pile of shit. But the most important thing is it works. And i can write a spyware program for mozzila, firefox or netscape with no problem, the only reason it doesn't happens is because of the amount of users.
So i don;t think that you can give IE a disrespect because it handles alot of rules in a time a otherbrowser would dream of.

Now you may not care ,but me and my wife run large companys,that often have the need for a service that you(up until 20 min. ago)provided.I'm sure Papa would want to bust somebodys ass for the way his patrons are being treated.Putting everything else aside,one customer is too many to lose.I sure hope when I am able to start my own company I make enogh profit that I can hire little as**oles like your Troy in Shepherdsville to run off all my loyal customers.Just so you know I've taken the liberty of disclosing the amount of money you will lose in the next 6 months being as that is how much me, my family,and our companies have spent in the last 6 months(2,265.43).Once loyal,now looking.

comment.name: Don Goodman
comment.comment:
Yesterday, we picked up our grand kids for the special long awaited weekend. Our income is lower now and we have to be careful. My wife saved a coupon from Papa Johns in order to get their favorite pizza that we usually do when we get to keep them. It is 2 mdeium pizzas with any topping for $13.99. When we picked them up they were $20.31. I was told by the smart talking girl. I asked for the manager as I could not afford the increase. He said the coupon which came in our paper was no good as he was not a corporate store and he did not HAVE to honor them. I told him I was going to try to contact the company and he said he did not care. I had to pay the price as the kids were expecting them. You have very good pizzas but ill trained employees. The paper in our small town should have said the Mooresville NC store does not accept these coupons. It would have saved us a lot of money and time. We are very disappointed in your company.
Thanks, Don Goodman

comment.name: Lynnette Rex
comment.comment:
The students next door to me ordered pizza from Papa John's. When it was delivered to them, the delivery boy, parked in my 'HANDICAPPED' parking space. I phoned the local store and very nicely asked the manager to explain/ask deliverly people to refrain from using HANDICAPPED' spaces for pizza deliveries. He told me "he didn't think deliverly persons using handicapped spaces was 'that big of a deal'and besides they were only using the space for 'a few minutes', so I should get over it".
Not only does their product bite arse in my opinion, the management is rude and discourtious. I will never do business with them again because of the lousy pizza, and now I suggest they are "BOYCOTTED" because of their attitude. Handicapped people just like the temporarily abled, also eat!

comment.name: Delivery Driver
comment.comment:
Ive delivered pizzas for more than 6 yrs,first at Pizza Hut
and now at Papa Johns and I have heard the same complaints over and over again,but I'd like to tell you what it's like from our point of view and maybe you will
be as understanding of us, as we try very hard to be with you
Complaints about being put on hold for too long:you might want to consider the fact that there are only so many lines and so many people to answer them and if you call during the dinner rush then you will have to wait til we finish taking the order of the ones who called first
Of course ,it would go faster if they KNEW what they wanted to order beforehand,but that would be unreasonable, I suppose, since customers have to have the specials read over to them several times ,then they have to shout to the others in the background"What do you want on it"?(in our ear I might add) they come ba ck with can we get half this and half that--Yes Sir/Ma'am. Well, we want thus and so. so we type it all up and just when we think they are done, they change the whole order (even worse is when they call back 10-15 min later and change it all again--after it has been made and put in the oven,sometimes they change their minds after we have left the store with it) So,the reason you have to wait so long is because we have to take so much time with the first callers.You all seem to know exactly how long you are on hold,well then, how about seeing just how much time we have to spend on you when we take your order and you can't make up your mind.Oh and another thing---IT would be NICE if you KNEW where you lived!!I can't tell you how much time I waste trying to find someone who can't give directions to their own home, or don't tell us they have moved,not to mention those who have no number visible from the road at night,and could you PLEASE cut on some lights so we know someone is home?Our job is dangerous enough(we're ranked just behind police and firemen on the list of most dangerous jobs)without having to walk up to houses with no lights on and the possibility we may be assaulted and robbed
Complaints about how long your delivery takes:
This is a 1st come 1st served business and if the customers before you take alot of time then yours will be later as a result.Answer the door(DON'T scream "Who the f*** is it?"--you called us!!) when we get there don't make us ring and knock repeatedly before you answer because you're busy on the phone or whatever and PLEASE have the common courtesy to set the phone down while we are conducting business,you're going to need both hands to take the pizza/wings/sodas and exchange money.And if you simply MUST run to the store/take shower,etc leave the money to pay with someone that is available
If you find it necessary to send your children to the door,make sure they are big enough to carry the HOT pizzas with out mishap,and if you want to tip,tell them how much
(some of you out there might want to know that the tips you set aside for us are going into your teens pockets,one girl even tried to get the tip money that was included on a check from me)Speaking of checks,please have your checkbook AND IDentification ready,don't have us stand there waiting while you run about your house and out to your car looking for it. WE ARE going to check your id--just like any other place you shop, so don't leave a check with your child or the babysitter,etc The same goes for Credit/Debit cards.YOU have to be there to show ID to prove you are who you say you are,for your own safety as well as for our own----if your checks or credit card were stolen, you'd expect us to catch that by checking ID,so don't yell and curse at us for asking for it.(and please return the pen I loaned you to write your check because you couldn't find one in your own house)
The faster I can finish our transaction,the faster I can deliver the next order.Remember that the next time you wonder what took us so long and don't add to the problem.Time is money in this business and we try our best to make our deliveries as fast as possible in order to make a decent living,so don't "gum up the works"by
taking more time than necessary to complete your order/delivery
When we tell you your order will be delivered in 45min-1 hr,listen to ALL we say,don't call back in 30-45 min wanting to know where your pizza is,you're wasting the time needed to take orders/make pizzas,etc and its not going to get it there any faster by
causing us to stop what we are doing to answer your irate phone call,plus you are tying up needed phone lines We KNOW you don't like to be on hold so think about the other customers you are causing to be kept on hold while we spend more unecessary time on you
Just so you know,Screaming,cursing and threatening us
will not get your order there any faster either-- I admit we are not perfect,although we really do try our best, we do make mistakes,and if you have a LEGITIMATE complaint we will do all we can to rectify it,but there is no reason to call us every vulgarity you can think of,(you know we can't respond in kind so we make a good target when you have had a bad day,but would you like us to treat you that way at your workplace?)
Don't accuse US of being rude when we are NOT,simply
because you can't get your way and have free pizzas
when its not late or made incorrectly.There are many scam artist out there and they use this as the excuse whenever they can't get their food free any other way.
We could lose our jobs if this happens more than once,and unless you wish to be in court for slander,you might want to rethink your course of action--we do know your name and where you live,so it would not be hard to have you charged with slander when you cost us our job(check with a lawyer if you don't believe me)
I can also guarantee that I can bring in a roomful of people(customers included) to vouch for my character and my ability to control myself under verbal assault
(I have been in the customer service business for over
30 yrs and believe me I've seen it all)
Treat us the way you want to be treated and we will do the same to you,and remember that you get more flies with sugar than you will with vinegar. And think about
how you would feel if your son or daughter(most phone people are high school students) was the one being subjected to such vulgar,vicious,and threatening
words.
(One man recently threatened to bring his chainsaw up to our store because he couldn't get his food for free when there was no reason to do so)Some of these teens have burst into tears after being attacked verbally on the phone by an irate customer,some have quit their jobs because the abuse was overwhelming to them(How would you like for your child to be treated in this manner? I KNOW I wouldn't!!)
By the way,we do a MILLION Dollars a year in sales at our store alone so threatening to take your business elsewhere just makes us laugh,especially since we KNOW you WILL be calling back when you decide you want pizza for dinner and you don't want to leave your
house to get. There are only so many places that provide that service,for FREE I might add.(I'm NOT going get on the subject of people who "STIFF" us on tips when their order is FAST,HOT,PREPARED CORRECTLY and delivered during snow/ice/rain storms,flooding or heatwaves despite the traffic/construction work/roadclosures/bridge outages or parades that we have to deal with in order to deliver your food.Don't insult us by telling us we shouldn't be out in such nasty weather and to drive carefully--you called us or we wouldn't be there)
--NOW, tip & tip well--we deserve it for all we do
to cater to your needs,take your abuse,save you time and aggravating traffic conditions, GAS usage and having to prepare your own food
Having vented my own anger now I would like to express my deepest thanks to those customers who treat us with respect and courtesy at all times(even if we have flubbed up) who greet us with a smile to match our own and appreciate all the hard work we do to provide them with the freshest,fastest,best made food we possibly can-----YOU are the customers who keep us coming back to work each day
THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART..........if there were only more like you......:))

comment.name: SIHuze
comment.comment:
I feel you on this one. I found this post while trying to find the phone# for MCI's bill department.
I had MCI for log distance on my home phone for about a year. When I moved my old roommate put the bill in his name 1 month before I moved. We set it up so the last bill would still be in my name. I received the last bill and paid it. A mouth later I got another one for $13. I thought I missed something and paid it sense the customer service reps where so positive that the bill was right. I received a bill about a week later so I just assumed that it and the payment crossed in the mail. The month after that I got another bill for the same phone (another $13 dollars and late charges). I called my friend to see if he was getting billed by MCI too. He said that the he paid the last bill that was supposed to be sent to me sense it was only $13 and had been receiving (and paying) every month sense. We called MCI and explained to them what was going on. They cent me a check for $26 and said that it was all fixed.
A year later I got a bill in the mail for $13. I called them and said that I was responsible for the charges (I haven't had MCI sense I moved). I tried to tell the lady about the mix up that happened before and that MCI had sent me a check. She said that I had to be lying because her computer should that no one and called about the account in two years. She got an attitude so I asked to speak with her manager. That got me put on hole for just under an hour, I timed it. While I was on holed I noticed that the last 7 digits where the same as my old # the area code was wrong. The manager talked right over me when she picked up. When I got the chance to I tolled her that I never lived in a place with a 910 area code and I could prove it. The manager said It's only $13 dollars, why don't I just pay it? I refused and tolled her that they would hear from a lawyer if it wasn't resolved that day. I got put on holed again. They got every thing fixed after that; at least I thought they did. It's been almost 2 years now and I just got a bill from a collocations agency for that same 910 #

comment.name: Tomas
comment.comment:
"Shouldn't I be able to make backup copies of my discs and play them?"

I'm not 100% sure about what the law says in the US, but AFAIK, no, you can't. You can make backups of data not programs. It is illegal to make a copy of a program for personal use, while it is perfectly legal to do the same of a CD or DVD. Unless of course the US law deviates from the "standard".

comment.comment: That's music CD or DVD movie, of course.

Hell yeah!
you are darn right with all of what you said there. I live in Germany and the industry leaders just got politicians to pass a new Europe-wide law which (a) allows you to do a backup copy of a legally purchased object (CD, Software, Book etc.) containing intellectual capital and (b) on the other hand makes you a criminal as long as you have to bypass any copy protection in the process of doing such a copy! "Please be aware that some or all of your domain names have been moved to a new system. As a result, you can no longer purchase additional products on this account at this Web site. You will receive new Account Manager login instructions from the company that sold you those names. Meanwhile, you can click here to manage your domain names right now."
Since I'm not familiar with this new system, and already have 37 domains together under register.com's administration system I don't want to go there.
They leave me with no choice but to register with another registrar that I feel comfortably with.

comment.name: Anonymous Coward
comment.comment:
You think that's bad? Here is the text of a message I sent to Register.com late last year. Things may be better there now, I don't know.
"We are now into the 13th day of getting jerked around. I again request access to the account I paid for. I have made repeated requests by e-mail and by phone call. The e-mails have been ignored, the phone calls have not been at all helpful and have been counterproductive.
Let me reiterate & summarize. I registered 4 domain names in bulk with register.com. A single charge of $140 was made tomy credit card. These were all renewals of accounts with register.com. For some reason 3 of the registered domain names were transferred to an entity whose legal name and business structure is unknown. One of the 4 domain names was retained by register.com. This transfer was made without notice or request.
My host server changed IP addresses for its accounts. I had to change the IP addresses for each of the domain names with the registrar so that the domain name would again point to physical location of the web server.
I accomplished this in a few minutes in my account atregister.com without human intervention for the domain name not transferred to Global Partnereu (GPN). I changed it in a few minutes with human assistance at Network Solutions after I ironed out a stale e-mail address problem. In 2 weeks I still have been unable to get access to my account at register.com's cut rate no frills entity. I would caution anyone to be careful and avoid the same problems I faced in trying to get a very simple problem solved. I started this process 2 weeks ago and I am no further ahead today than I was back then.
One of the problems with the storefront entity, partnereu, is that it has little technical phone support. There is a webpage where you can send an e-mail, and there is a phone number with a recorded message that states that there is no telephone technical support. It is strictly e-mail support.
My first e-mail requested access to my newly created partnereu account. I stated that the register. com password did not work. It was answered in a few days and it suggested I get access to the stale e-mail account on file. They could send a new password to that e-mail address. I answered it immediately asking if I could use a quick method of getting access similar to that used at register.com and network solutions. I stressed the urgency of getting the account up& running. This e-mail was ultimately answered 1 week later.
In the meantime I sent e-mails everyday telling them the urgency of getting my business back on-line. It was very frustrating being ignored for a very simple problem and not being able to talk to a human. In retrospect, the whole problem could have been solved by merely unlocking the account so that it reset to the default register.com password. It was a 2 minute solution.
After several e-mails, I became frustrated and calledregister.com to have them help me out since they unilaterally transferred my account to their unresponsive no frills entity. Register.com offered absolutely no help and gave me the impression that because I registered the domain names with their affiliate I was on my own to resolve it.
My e-mails to register.com had an auto-reply to contact the partnereu e-mail support group. I reiterated my dilemma a few times by e-mail copying both register & its affiliate telling them they both had responsibility for getting me access to the account so I could get my business up again. The response was always auto-reply from register pointing me to partnereu and dead silence from partnereu.
After several days of no response from partnereu and no access by phone, I tried to pressure register.com telephone support staff to help. I tried to convince them that I had originally registered with them after responding to their request for renewal of the domain names. They told me that the renewals were not technically with register but were sent by Global Partner Network (GPN)/register.com
I told them that I originally registered the domain names onthe register.com website and had renewed annually with register.com They told me that this time GPN sent the renewal e-mails and I had really renewed with them. I told them that I had an e-mail receipt from register.com. Despite my paid receipt from register.com with no reference on it to any other entity, I was advised that internally it was a transaction with GPN/partnereu. They were unwilling to give any assistance.
Each time I tried to call register.com I was transferred to the partnereu voice mail line stating that there was no technical support. Several times I said to the register.com support staff, "no don't transfer me to the voice mail again". They would put me on hold for a few minutes and say,"Ok I am going to transfer you to a human this time. I always got transferred to the voice mail brushoff.
One of the register.com support staff tried to convince that my real problem was with Logika. They had technically acted as the registrar and they would be in the best position toresolve this. Even though I knew that Logika did not have my account, I called them. They told me that they were not involved in the least. They acted as a front end in the process not interfacing with the consumer. The support guy there told me to look at whois.com where it clearly stated that the registrar was register.com.
After I waited on hold at register.com support line several times over the next few days, I heard the advertisement suggesting callers easily transfer their existing domain names to register.com. I had one of my few original ideas. I said to the support guy that I had 3-4 domain names in an account with another registrar. I wanted to know if I could transfer one of them to register.com. After an enthusiastic 'yes' I gave him the name of my transferred partnereu domain name. I figured it was worth another $35 to get my businessup & running. When i told him the domain name, he said it was already registered at register.com. Despite it being at entity partnereu I could not transfer it back. It was locked.
On one call to register.com I found a helpful lady who fetched a helpful GPN support guy instead of the usual transfer to limbo or expression of sympathy at my having registered with another registrar. After verifying my identity the staff person emailed me a password & username to access the partnereu account. The password did not work. The staff person declined to give me his name & phone number because he was temporarily helping the GPN staff & probably couldn't be reached again.
I sent an immediate e-mail and called partnereu billing inquiry line. I told them I had just spoken to a person who sent me a bad password. I asked to speak to him so I could get another one. Unfortunately, partnereu does not have 24/7help like register.com so I had to wait until the next day. I asked the billing person to please put a written note on the guy's desk to reset the account & e-mail me a newpassword. The next day I got the same password a second timeand it did not work either. The average wait time on all myphone calls was 15 minutes; the longest was 35 minutes.
I received a phone call on Friday from a register.com employee who said he was a supervisor. I called back & let it ring 10 times without getting any voice mail. I called Saturday, this time I was able to leave a phone message. I checked to see if maybe this guy would be helpful and have e-mailed me a password, or reset my account so it would be up & running for the weekend. No such luck.
I sit here on my 13th day of great customer support waiting for the 2 minutes of assistance I need to get my business up & running. I have spent over 10 hours during this time just trying to get access to the account that was transferred for me."
I am having my accounts transfered to another registrar for 1/2 of the cost this year.

comment.name: Arcterex
comment.comment:
Interesting. Under linux I run a program (well, actually a shell script) called 'abcde' (A Better CD Encoder) which takes a couple of args (-N -x IIRC) that simply auto-rips a cd to ogg and ejects the CD. Re-insert new cd, hit uparrow+enter and repeat. Or GRIP which will auto-rip on CD insertion and eject, so all you do is pop in CD after CD and close the drive when it pops out.
And it will do it into whatever format I want, ogg, mp3, wav, flaac, etc. No DRM, no propriatory crap.
Maybe the quality of rippers under windows sucks badly compared to a shell script. Sad, but hey, as a monopoly MS can give you anything they want right? Choice doesn't matter.
Oh, and I think the reasons to hate WMP9 includes that whole "privacy" thing, and the propriatory nature of it all :)

comment.name: Chris
comment.comment:
Well, it's all situational really. You can run the MT CGIs one of two ways: as the Apache user/group (www), or as a specifi or logged on user. If you run MT under the www account, Apache needs write access to generate your web files when you add a post, and when someone adds a comment. I'm no to fond of that.
So I decided to run the CGIs under my account via suExec. While this means all new entries write files as me and Apache doesn't need write access, it also means comments no longer work because Apache doesn't have write access.
I installed a set of patches from Sean Willson (http://www.seanwillson.com/archives/2003/04/27/000501/) that allowed me to turn off index rebuilds when comments are posted. I also hacked the MT::App::Comments and MT::App::Trackback modules to not rebuild entries when comment are posted.
I then installed mt-rebuild (http://mt-plugins.org/archives/mini/mtrebuild.php) and set up my crontab to schedule rebuilds of the index page and entries to display any new comments.

comment.comment:
True, it is easier, but I've had problems in the past (at least on Windows) where the current working directory and @INC is based on where you're running perl from, and not where the script itself resides due to using the full script path. Usualy this was a problem when trying to develop CPAN modules and test them in the local ./lib or ./blib directory.
Plus, (and maybe I need to create an extended example), using cmd.exe instead allows me to prepend additional commands that perform make clean and make before I run the actual Perl script in question.

comment.name: Uncle Kridley

You can specify arguments by including one of the Eclipse-supplied variables on your command line. If you use "${string_prompt}", Eclipse will pop up a dialog when you Run; "${file_prompt}" will pop up a file selection box. You can enter multiple arguments in one string_prompt...
Unfortunately, 3.0M7 is a bit stoopid, and right after the argument dialog pops up, it pops up a small yellow banner-ish thing at the bottom of the main eclipse window, which submerges the argument dialog under the window (so you have to alt-tab back to it). Annoying, but minor.

Another tip for Linux / BSD / Solaris / OS X:
Some users may have problems seeing output from certain scripts. To fix it, you must redirect the output to stdout, like so:
-w ${resource_loc} &>1
Note the "&>1". This should go in the arguments section.

comment.name: Chris
comment.comment:
Actually, I stole the foreach loop code directly from CGI::Cookies' raw_fetch sub.
Since the target server doesn't have Apache::Cookie installed, and the stock 5.6.1 CGI::Cookie is borked under mod_perl, I just ripped the code to make it slim.
Seems to work as intended.
On the formatting side, I'm thinking about revamping the layout again so we can use 100% of the page width in code samples.

comment.name: J$
comment.comment: I was shocked... *shocked* to find such a regex in CGI::Cookie. So, just to make sure I was not going crazy, I conferred with my monkish brethren (http://www.perlmonks.org/index.pl?node_id=299587). That regex is, indeed, broken. I am submitting a patch. comment.comment:
Larry of Roanoke VA (12/15/03):
Lowe's, through their credit card, offers no-interest promotional purchases from time to time. The problem is, Monogram Bank makes it very difficult to pay these off. When they receive your payment, they apportion it to the regular balance as well as any promotional purchases. It took us months to get them to properly apply our payments to promotional purchases so we could avoid the interest. Additionally, the monthly statement is very difficult to decipher. We will never use this credit card again!
Darlene of Leesburg VA writes (6/4/02):
In October 2001, my fiance and I bought a new home. We decided to open separate Lowe's accounts (his limit was $250, mine was $300) to buy a washer and dryer. We purchased these and were given 6 months of "no payments". My first payment of $15 is due on June 19, 2002.
On June 3, 2002, I received a letter from the Monogram Bank of Georgia stating that my account had been closed due to my credit score changing. I called and asked how they could cancel my account when I had done nothing wrong and my first payment wasn't even due yet. They stated that because I bought a home, my credit score dropped so after a review of my credit they decided to close my account. I argued that nothing had changed since I was approved by Lowe's. I was approved AFTER I had bought the home so they knew of this purchase BEFORE they approved me.
Now my credit will be adversely affected because they closed my account. How is it possible that they can close my account when I don't have bad credit with them? I am in perfect standing with them. Based on a "credit review", they are making a judgement about me that has nothing to do with my account with them. They also closed my fiance's account 2 months after he opened it for the same reason.
Ed of Lenoir City, TN (4/17/02):
Lowes Credit Card issued 4/25/01 (later I found out it was issued by Monogram Bank Of Georgia) with a creit limit of $1500. Purchased refrigerator for about $1300 on a no-payments, no-interest basis until Jan 2002. Fine print says 6 months but promo was Jan 2002. In Nov 2001 I refinanced and paid off Sears, Pennys, Home Depot, and 3 credit cards totalling about $5000-$6000. Obviously, my credit score should have improved (had no delinquencies on any accounts and making monthly payments to Lowes).
In December I get a letter from Monogram Bank stating after reviewing my account they were lowering my credit limit to $500. My balance at the time was about $1250 because I had made some small purchases and I was making $20 monthly payments at the time. Now I find out that the credit bureaus show my Lowe's account as over the limit when I did nothing to cause this. Main office customer service denied this until I faxed a copy of my Eqifax credit report and then the response was there was nothing they could do that the decision was based on my credit file which, as I stated earlier, should have been better at this time than when the account was first opened.

I have a WMP11 card in one of my PCs, and I too get the random disconnects, but I've come to notice it's not so random after all - it seems to disconnect after a certain amount of data has passed through it - I can reliably and consistently kill it by trying to copy a CD image across it. I haven't figured out exactly what byte count kill it yet, but it seems to be somewhere around 400-500 megs. Regular usage will kill it after a couple of days. Heavy network file ops will do it in a matter of hours.
At least with SP2, it's a simple matter of "repairing" the connection, which disconnects, reconnects, reassociates, and then renews the IP address. Kills your file transfer, though.

comment.name: Matthew Cunliffe
comment.comment:
I've just resorted to switching back to WEP 128 bit from WPA-PSK. I've narrowed it down to the fact that the 801.2xx authentication option is automatically ticked (checked) with WPA and is also disabled, so that the user is unable to amend it.
Since the authentication is only ever of use if you have a RADIUS server or some other certification server sitting out there, it times out attempting to authenticate and therefore will not obtain a DHCP lease.
My original solution was to manually kick it into action by forcing it to look for the router or restarting the router.
The question is whether the fault lies with Windows and it's setup for wireless authentication or Linksys drivers?

comment.name: Mike Gale
comment.comment:
The fundamentals of VS seem to support xhtml, but layers of stuff over the basics are ill behaved. Some ways to get what you want:
1) Start in source mode. If you can, never touch that horrible design mode.
2) If you use design mode (like placing controls) do it at the start of building an aspx. After using it fix the information that has been messed up. Then never go in again.
3) If you touch an aspx with design mode put the header into the clipboard first!
4) After the development is done load it into a staging web server. Go in there with some decent tools (Homesite still has a place...) and fix the formatting. Publish to live site from there.
If you're using the xhtml (produced by your ASPX) from code this is NOT optional.
I'd love to see an alternative to the "design surface". The UI in Homesite based on WYSIWYN (What you see is what you need) is so superior it takes you breath away.

comment.name: Bryan
comment.comment:
I don't see any way in the documentation to do this with a TcpClient, but if you had a System.Net.Sockets.Socket instead, you could use BeginConnect/EndConnect to do a connection timeout.
I had to do something similar a while back. I ended up creating a private wrapper class holding a reference to the Socket, plus a reference to a ManualResetEvent. When I need to do the connect, I set up a new wrapper, then called the Socket's BeginConnect method (the state object is the wrapper class). In the AsyncCallback delegate's target method, I Set() the event, then call EndConnect() on the socket.
Back in the main function, I do a WaitOne on the ManualResetEvent (the overload that has a timeout). If the timeout elapses, then I close the socket (which invokes the AsyncCallback, which when I call EndConnect(), throws either a SocketException with ErrorCode 10061, or an ObjectDisposedException, which I ignore). Otherwise, I continue, and close the socket later.
It's only about 15-25 lines of code in all. Of course, that's still a heck of a lot more than a Connect overload that takes a timeout, but it is at least possible.
If you could get at the Socket reference of the TcpClient, you could do something similar. But I don't think you can (I don't believe the Socket is even created until you try to connect the TcpClient, though I could be wrong on that).

comment.name: Corso
comment.comment: As a former reservist, I can sympathize with Mr. Parish - up to a point. I can't speak as to the particulars of his enlistment contract. However, in my experience, I was informed and aware of, up front, that after my 8 years of reserve duty were completed, that I would be then transferred to the IRR (Individual Ready Reserve), from which, in time of national need, I could be reactivated, until age 51. The language in the enlistment contracts that I've seen from the different brances of service is very consistent about this. I will be following Mr. Parish's case with interest.

comment.name: Christopher Laco
comment.comment:
I have to agree on that point. If he was informed verbally or contractually that he would be put in IRR and it's obligations, then I think he's just plain stuck.
Now, on that note, I think the manditory placement of people into the IRR is slightly questionable.

comment.name: Corso
comment.comment:
I agree with you on mandatory placement in the IRR, but my (former) father-in-law, who was an officer in the Army Signal Corps put it this way: 'After you sign on the dotted line, you're theirs. Especially if your rate/MOS is considered critical.' He finished his active duty with NASA doing satellite communications networks, then retired a few years ago, still consulting for NASA and the odd government agency.
Cheers,
Corso

comment.name: University of Michigan
comment.comment: Our tests of firefox pr 1 for OS X were similarly disappointing. We were able to auto detect some feeds but subscribed feeds did not stick after restarting the app. Once feeds were subscribed, attempting to open the bookmarks menu would cause the app to crash. This was repeated many times successively. Was also slow as a dog and we could hear the processor and drives grinding away as soon as we launched the app. Were assuming (hoping) the performance and bugginess will be taken care of by the time 1.0 is finalized. That said, 0.9.3 is an amazing browser and PR 1 looks to be even better if they can address these problems. IE/Safari/Opera look out! -University of Michigan http://www.umich.edu/

comment.name: David
comment.comment: No problems with my bookmarks here. I would have to 2nd the complaint of Firefox 1.0PR being dog slow. There is a noticable performance hit compared to 0.9.3 However, I do like the live bookmark implementation of RSS. I like not having to fire up yet another app to read feeds. It seems Firefox 1.0PR wants to see a content-type tag set to the feed type (rss, xml, atom). Not all sites that have feeds have this. Hopefully they'll fix the performance issues fairly soon. In the meantime I just may go back to 0.9.3

comment.name: Stephen
comment.comment: I had a bookmarks disappear problem as well. What happened was that I had the Sage extension installed and everything worked fine. I decided to remove Sage and after I restarted the browser, my bookmarks were gone as well as the bookmark toolbar. I then went to the Bookmarks->Manage Bookmarks and saw all my bookmarks were still there. I then exited and my bookmarks showed up from the Bookmarks dropdown list but toolbar was still missing. I then re-installed Sage and now I have my bookmarks back.

comment.name: Fergus
comment.comment:
Hi there, I had thought Firefox 1.0PR had broken the BugMeNot extension also but then I saw that the extension (in version 0.6) made a UI change around the same time as the 1.0PR release.
Now BugMeNot only shows up in the Firefox Right Click Context Menu if you put your mouse pointer over a username/password field.
So it was there and working fine but I took some time to notice it.
--
Fergus

comment.name: Chess
comment.comment:
If you can keep all the variations of dialect straight enough to properly compare my hats off to you. Why not build the application once and complete in one framework, then pit that against another in the second round, winner progresses, etc etc.
For Rails I suggest that before you tackle a section, review the relevant RailsCasts.com (Ryan Bates) on that section. Also grab the WhatsNew in Rails 2.1 pdf (2nd Edition).
Good luck!

comment.name: Christopher H. Laco
comment.comment:
I chose to complete each step in all frameworks together is that I should be able to better compare each step across all frameworks. My fear with completing the project on one framework before moving to another was that I would forget my thoughts and grievances byt the time I moved on to a new framework.
I guess time will tell.

comment.comment: You should definitely replace django 0.96 with trunk.

comment.name: Christopher H. Laco

I'll have to think about that. I am using the RC2 of CakePHP. My fear with trunk Django is that if I run into problrms, I might be in new territory. Whereas if I stick with .96, plenty of people have made it through that already.
Plus, I installed using fink on my MBP as I didn't want to fight any install issues...just get it all up an running asap.

comment.name: Samori Gorse
comment.comment:
I think you should more fear the fact that 0.96 is one year old and that plenty of enhancements have been made since. :-)
I guess most of the people currently working with django use trunk, and a lot of useful applications are based on django-trunk (e.g django-registration, django-evolution, etc...)
Anyway, good luck ;)

comment.name: Sjoerd
comment.comment: Hi, nice series! Looking forward to the other parts. Note that Rails adds the created_at and updated_at columns because of the "t.timestamps" line in your migration file. Remove that and they won't get created. It is there by default, but it is easily removed.
